page.title: 02LOCAL FACILITIES
page.content: VILLAGE BUS: a privately run mini-coach to Oxford on alternate Wednesdays. PAPERS:morning,evening, Sunday rounds. ALLOTMENTS:19 owned by Queens College. TELEPHONE: kiosk at edge of Green. CARAVANS: Certificated Location. BALDON FEAST: mid-August, with a fair. CLUBS:W.I.,Youth and Sen.Citizens clubs POST OFFICE: Mrs Mawer. Mr.Mawer post man. Tiny room in own house. Just P.O. services. Post collected twice per day. House delivery once per day. NEWSLETTER: run voluntarily by P.C.C. Edited Jan Burgess; monthly issues. TRADERS: Bread 3 times per week. Fish once.Roadmaster 'juggernaut' with general goods and groceries weekly. LIBRARY: van once a week. POLICE: main station, Abingdon. Local 'bobby' based at Culham, 5 miles away. MILK: Mr.Wells and Mr.Almond local farm rounds. All milk now pasteurised.
